Package spaces

Class EndSpace

java.lang.Object
spaces.ColoredSpace
spaces.EndSpace
public class EndSpace
extends ColoredSpace
Class implementing an end space.

Players on the end space retire, and, if all players have reached the end space, the game ends.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    EndSpace()
    Creates an end space object

  • Method Summary

    java.lang.String getInfo​(Player currPlayer)

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • EndSpace

      public EndSpace()
      Creates an end space object

      In particular, an end space has its attributes initialized as follows:

      • Its color is assigned as "Special (End)".
      • Its index on the board is the last index on the board.
      • Its next indices are both -1 (a sentinel value to indicate) that this is the last space on the board.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute​(Player currPlayer, Bank b, int orderRetirement, CareerCardDeck careerDeck, SalaryCardDeck salaryDeck, HouseCardDeck houseDeck)
      Executes the action associated with this space; that is, the player is retired

      After reaching the end space, the stats of the player are no longer affected by the actions of the remaining players who are still active.

      Parameters:
      currPlayer - current player with turn
      b - Bank of the game
      orderRetirement - order in which the player retired (e.g., first to retire, second to retire, etc.)
      careerDeck - CareerCardDeck of the game
      salaryDeck - SalaryCardDeck of the game
      houseDeck - HouseCardDeck of the game

    • getInfo

      public java.lang.String getInfo​(Player currPlayer)
      Returns the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player on the end space

      In particular, the returned string reads as follows: "[Player name], you are on the end space. Congratulations! You are now retired."

      Specified by:
      getInfo in class ColoredSpace
      Parameters:
      currPlayer - current player with turn
      Returns:
      string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player is on the end space
